data.name: newsletter.listing.howto.content
data.value: Xperience Email Marketing and How to use it?

data.name: srch.index.includeattachments
data.value: If selected, the index includes the text content of files attached to the specified pages. Only applies for pages whose page type has the 'Content fields' or 'Both' data source selected in the Page types application on the Search tab.

data.name: srch.index.includecategories
data.value: If selected, the index stores the display names of Categories assigned to the specified pages. This allows users to find pages that belong to categories whose name matches the search expression. Only applies for pages whose page type has the 'Content fields' or 'Both' data source selected in the Page types application on the Search tab.

data.name: srch.index.user.description
data.value: Sets the user account under which the crawler indexes pages. Only applies for pages whose page type has the 'HTML output' or 'Both' data source selected in the Page types application on the Search tab. If empty, the index uses the default 'administrator' account.

data.name: srch.pagedatasource.tooltip
data.value: HTML output Indexes the HTML output of pages based on the structure of the content tree. Pages that are implemented without a representation in the Xperience content tree are NOT included. This index type is suitable mainly for pages utilizing the Page builder. Page content fields Indexes the structured content of pages in the content tree, which includes page fields, metadata, and any file attachments. This type of index is suitable for pages with structured content (specified on the Content tab), as Page builder data is not indexed. Both data sources This index type combines the two options above. Use this index if you want to enable site visitors to search Page builder content as well as the structured content.

data.name: srch.pagedatasource.disabled.tooltip
data.value: Content fields is the only available data source for indexing. To enable all data sources, you need to first enable the URL page type feature on the Features tab (only possible if there are no pages already created for this page type).

data.name: srch.pageresults.smarttip.header
data.value: Setting up fields for search results

data.name: srch.pageresults.smarttip.content
medialibrary.libraryusedirectpathforcontent.description
data.value: Direct path to media library files will be used when adding the files to your content in Xperience, e.g. by using the rich text editor or a widget. Files with direct path are not handled by the system (no permission or security restrictions are enforced, no resizing or editing is applied).

data.name: medialibrary.libraryusedirectpathforcontent.name
data.value: Use direct path for files in content

data.name: srch.settings.indexupdatetrigger.tooltip
data.value: Use the check boxes in this column to mark fields that will trigger an update of the search index. When the 'Index update trigger' check box is selected for a specific field, the system automatically updates the search index every time the content of the field is updated.

data.name: srch.settings.content.tooltip
data.value: If selected, the content of the field is indexed and searchable in the standard way. The values of all fields with the 'Content' option enabled are combined into a single system field used to find or filter matching search items (but not suitable for reading and displaying human-readable information such as search result extracts).

data.name: srch.settings.searchable.tooltip
data.value: If selected, the field is stored separately within indexes and its content can be searched using expressions in format: '<field code name>:<searched phrase>'

data.name: srch.settings.tokenized.tooltip
data.value: Relevant for 'Searchable' fields. Indicates if the content of the field is processed by the analyzer when indexing. This allows the search to find results that match individual tokens (subsets) of the field's value. If disabled, the search only returns items if the full value of the field exactly matches the search expression.

data.name: srch.settings.azurecontent.tooltip
data.value: If selected, the field's value is added to the 'sys_content' system field within the search index. The 'sys_content' field combines the values of all fields with the 'Content' flag and has the 'Searchable' attribute enabled (i.e. the field is full-text searchable).

data.name: srch.settings.azureretrievable.tooltip
data.value: Sets the 'Retrievable' attribute for the field in the Azure Search index. This attribute indicates whether the field can be returned in a search result.

data.name: srch.settings.azuresearchable.tooltip
data.value: Sets the 'Searchable' attribute for the field in the Azure Search index. This attribute indicates whether the field is full-text searchable and can be referenced in search queries.

data.name: srch.settings.azurefacetable.tooltip
data.value: Sets the 'Facetable' attribute for the field in the Azure Search index. This attribute indicates whether to enable the field to be referenced in facet queries.

data.name: srch.settings.azurefilterable.tooltip
data.value: Sets the 'Filterable' attribute for the field in the Azure Search index. This attribute indicates whether to enable the field to be referenced in '$filter' queries.

data.name: srch.settings.azuresortable.tooltip
data.value: Sets the 'Sortable' attribute for the field in the Azure Search index. This attribute indicates whether to enable the field to be referenced in '$orderby' expressions.

data.name: srch.settings.ifield.tooltip
data.value: Relevant for 'Searchable' fields. The specified value is used as a substitute for the field code name in search expressions of format '<field code name>:<searched phrase>'.

data.name: srch.settings.nocontentfields
data.value: This page type doesn't have any content fields configured. However, the page's system fields can still be used for indexing. You can see system fields indexing options in the Modules application -> Pages -> Classes -> Page -> Search tab.

data.name: settingskey.cmscmlegitimateinterestactivitiesenabled
data.value: Log activities based on legitimate interest

data.name: settingskey.cmscmlegitimateinterestactivitiesenabled.description
data.value:
If enabled, the system logs 'On-line form submission' activities even for visitors who have not given consent to be tracked as contacts and do not have the required cookie level set. Data added into the system as a result of such activities only includes information explicitly entered into the form, and the logging does not enable any other type of tracking for the visitor.
Important: You need to ensure that personal data obtained through such activities is only used for legitimate interest purposes, based on your site's legal requirements. For example, using the data to send unsolicited marketing messages may be a breach of data protection regulations.

data.name: settingskey.cmsbouncedemailaddress.description
data.value: Sets the address to which bounced emails are sent when the delivery of a marketing email to a recipient fails. If set, this address is used in the From field of marketing emails.

data.name: settingskey.cmsuseculturealiasaslanguageprefixinurl
data.value: Use culture alias as language prefix in URLs

data.name: settingskey.cmsuseculturealiasaslanguageprefixinurl.description
data.value:
If selected, the system generates page URLs with culture aliases as language prefixes whenever a culture alias is specified. If there is no culture alias specified for a given culture, the culture code is used instead. E.g., '{domain}/en-US/Home' becomes '{domain}/en/Home' when the culture alias is set to 'en' for the 'English - United States' culture.

You can view and set culture aliases in the 'Localization' application on the 'Cultures' tab.

data.name: culture.editcultureconfirmation
data.value: Are you sure you want to save the changes? Saving the changes may lead to changes in page URLs. For example, changing the culture alias when using it as a language prefix in URLs will lead to regeneration of all URLs associated with the culture.

data.name: tasktitle.changelanguageprefixformat
data.value: Update page URL paths language prefix format

data.name: tasktitle.UpdatePageUrlPaths
data.value: Update page URL paths culture format

data.name: tasktitle.UpdateCulturePageUrlPaths
data.value: Update page URL paths culture format for {0} culture

data.name: settingskey.cmsenablesentimentanalysis.description
data.value: Enables analysis of text sentiment when editing page fields on the Content tab in the Pages application. The analysis is performed by the Microsoft Azure Text Analytics API (Cognitive Services).

data.name: settingskey.cmsazuretextanalyticsapiendpoint.description
data.value: The endpoint of the Microsoft Azure Text Analytics API resource that performs the text analysis. You can find the endpoint in the Microsoft Azure portal when viewing your Text Analytics (Cognitive Services) resource.

data.name: settingskey.cmsazuretextanalyticsapikey.description
data.value: A valid key of the Microsoft Azure Text Analytics API resource specified by the endpoint setting. You can manage API keys in the Microsoft Azure portal when viewing your Text Analytics (Cognitive Services) resource.

data.name: sentimentanalysis.emptysource
data.value: Please enter some text to analyze first and click Refresh.

data.name: sentimentanalysis.sentimentResult
data.value: The text has the following sentiment:

data.name: sentimentanalysis.servererror
data.value: An error occurred, please see Event log.

data.name: sentimentanalysis.unsupportedlanguage
data.value: Analysis of the submitted language is not supported.

data.name: contactmanagement.listing.howto.content
data.value: Learn about contacts and contact groups

data.name: contactmanagement.listing.howto.title
data.value: Not sure how to work with contacts?

data.name: contactgroup.listing.howto.content
data.value: Learn about contacts and contact groups

data.name: contactgroup.listing.howto.title
data.value: Not sure how to work with contact groups?

data.name: widgetzone.restrictedwidgets.savewarning
data.value: The page update includes a section type change, and some widgets could not be inserted due to the new section's widget zone restrictions. The widgets are available in the widget insert dialog and you can add them again to valid zones. After saving the page, these widgets will be lost permanently.

data.name: settingskey.cmsazurecomputervisionapikey.description
data.value: A valid key of the Microsoft Azure Computer Vision API resource specified by the endpoint setting. You can manage API keys in the Microsoft Azure portal when viewing your Computer Vision (Cognitive Services) resource.

data.name: settingskey.cmsazurecomputervisionendpoint.description
data.value: The endpoint of the Microsoft Azure Computer Vision API resource that performs the image recognition. You can find the endpoint in the Microsoft Azure portal when viewing your Computer Vision (Cognitive Services) resource.

data.name: settingskey.cmsenableimagerecognition.description
data.value: Enables image recognition when inserting images into the rich text content of the website. The generated description is used as the alternative text of the image. The image recognition is performed by the Microsoft Azure Computer Vision API (Cognitive Services).

data.name: settingskey.cmsazurecomputervisionconfidence.description
data.value: A numeric value between 0 and 1 that represents the minimum value of confidence required for a description to be admitted. If the confidence of a returned description is below the set value, the description is discarded.

data.name: medialibrary.upload.maliciousxml
data.value: One or more files failed to upload: the files contain potentially malicious content.

data.name: import.medialibrary.maliciousxml
data.value: Import failed. The following file contains potentially malicious content: '{0}'.

data.name: media.upload.maliciousxml
data.value: One or more files failed to upload: the files contain potentially malicious content.

data.name: webfarmservers_list.disableddelete
data.value: You cannot delete servers in the 'Healthy' or 'Transitioning' status when using Automatic web farms.

data.name: macrorule.cmsactivityopenednewslettere-mailperformedfornewsletter.description
data.value: Use when building conditions for activity triggers of automation processes. This rule is fulfilled only if the 'Opened marketing email' activity was (or was not) performed for the selected email feed. The Apple Mail Privacy Protection (MPP) feature may significantly impact the reliability of email open rate statistics. To mitigate this, we strongly recommend shifting your marketing focus to tracking of clicked links in emails.

data.name: macrorule.cmsactivityopenednewslettere-mailperformedforissue.description
data.value: Use when building conditions for activity triggers of automation processes. This rule is fulfilled only if the 'Opened marketing email' activity was (or was not) performed for the selected marketing email. The Apple Mail Privacy Protection (MPP) feature may significantly impact the reliability of email open rate statistics. To mitigate this, we strongly recommend shifting your marketing focus to tracking of clicked links in emails.

data.name: macrorule.cmscontacthasopenedspecifiednewsletterinthelastxdays.description
data.value: Checks if the contact has opened any marketing email of the selected email feed in the last X days. The Apple Mail Privacy Protection (MPP) feature may significantly impact the reliability of email open rate statistics. To mitigate this, we strongly recommend shifting your marketing focus to tracking of clicked links in emails.

data.name: macrorule.cmscontacthasopenedthelastnewsletterissue.description
data.value: Use when building conditions in the steps of automation processes. This rule checks if the contact has opened the most recently sent marketing email. The Apple Mail Privacy Protection (MPP) feature may significantly impact the reliability of email open rate statistics. To mitigate this, we strongly recommend shifting your marketing focus to tracking of clicked links in emails.

data.name: macrorule.cmscontacthasopenedspecifiednewsletterissue.description
data.value: Checks if the contact has opened the selected marketing email. The Apple Mail Privacy Protection (MPP) feature may significantly impact the reliability of email open rate statistics. To mitigate this, we strongly recommend shifting your marketing focus to tracking of clicked links in emails.

data.name: macrorule.cmscontacthasopenedspecifiednewsletterissueinthelastxdays.description
data.value: Checks if the contact has opened the selected marketing email in the last X days. The Apple Mail Privacy Protection (MPP) feature may significantly impact the reliability of email open rate statistics. To mitigate this, we strongly recommend shifting your marketing focus to tracking of clicked links in emails.

data.name: medialibrary.dependencytracker.header
data.value: The media file is used in the following items:

data.name: medialibrary.dependencytracker.infomessage
data.value: The system is only able locate usage of media files in system objects. If you use any media files directly in the code of your website, such usages are not listed here.

data.name: medialibrary.dependencytracker.nodatafound
data.value: No usages of this file were found in system objects. However, the file may be used directly in the code of your website.

data.name: exportobject.users.sameprivilegelevel
data.value: Cannot {0} a user with same privilege level as the current user.

data.name: roleusers.userlist.nodata
data.value: The selected site does not have any users assigned to it. Users first need to be assigned to the site before they can be assigned a role defined for that site.

data.name: url.validation.error
data.value: The link must begin with lowercased 'http://' or 'https://'

data.name: bizformgeneral.redirecttourl
data.value: The value must be a valid URL. Enter either a relative URL starting with '~/' or '/', or an absolute URL including the protocol (e.g., https).

data.name: settingskey.cmssmtpserverauthenticationtype.description
data.value: Selects the authentication mode used to connect to the SMTP server. The options are Basic authentication (fill in the 'SMTP server user' and 'SMTP server password' settings) and OAuth 2.0 token-based authorization (enter the 'SMTP server user' and select valid 'OAuth credentials').

data.name: settingskey.cmssmtpserveroauthcredentials.description
data.value: Select valid OAuth credentials when using the 'OAuth 2.0' authentication type. You can create and manage the credentials in the 'Email OAuth credentials' application.

data.name: settingskey.cmspop3authenticationtype.description
data.value: Selects the authentication mode used to connect to the mail server that stores bounced emails. The options are Basic authentication (fill in the 'User name' and 'Password' settings) and OAuth 2.0 token-based authorization (enter the 'User name' and select valid 'OAuth credentials').

data.name: settingskey.cmspop3oauthcredentials.description
data.value: Select valid OAuth credentials when using the 'OAuth 2.0' authentication type. You can create and manage the credentials in the 'Email OAuth credentials' application.

data.name: EmailOAuthCredentials_Edit.ErrorEmptyDisplayName
data.value: Enter a display name for the credentials.

data.name: EmailOAuthCredentials_Edit.ErrorEmptyClientID
data.value: Enter a Client ID for the OAuth provider.

data.name: EmailOAuthCredentials_Edit.ErrorEmptyClientSecret
data.value: Enter a Client Secret for the OAuth provider.

data.name: EmailOAuthCredentials_Edit.ErrorEmptyTenantID
data.value: Enter a Tenant ID for the OAuth provider.

data.name: EmailOAuthCredentials_Edit.SSLWarning
data.value: Your site might not be accessible over the secured HTTPS protocol which is required by OAuth authorization.

data.name: emailoauthcredentials.app.description
data.value: Allows management of OAuth credentials for connecting to SMTP or POP3 email servers. Add the required credential values, generate an access token, and then use the resulting credentials object when configuring email servers throughout the system. By default, the system provides a way to create OAuth credentials for Microsoft Exchange Online.

data.name: emailoauthtokendialog.providernotfound
data.value: Authentication provider '{0}' for credentials '{1}' was not found.

data.name: media.libraryui.listinginfo
data.value: This is the full listing of the folder '{0}'. {1} the full listing to display only files.

data.name: media.libraryui.listinginfo.search
data.value: This is the full listing. {0} the full listing to display only files.

data.name: media.file.import.foldertooltip
data.value: This file has not been imported yet.

data.name: dialogs.view.searchbynametitledesc
data.value: Search by file name, title or description

data.name: settingskey.cmsmedialibraryenableusagetracking.description
data.value: Enables an index that allows users to find where individual media library files are used within the system's content. For example, usage of a media file should be checked before a significant update or deletion of the file.

data.name: settings.media.smartsearchwarning
data.value: The media files usage tracking index is enabled but this feature is dependent on smart search indexing, which is disabled in the system.

data.name: settings.smartsearch.mediausagewarning
data.value: The smart search indexing is disabled but this feature is required for the media files usage tracking to work correctly.

data.name: cmsform.UnpublishedRedirectUrlExplanationText
data.value: After this page is unpublished, user will be redirected to the selected URL.

data.name: cmsform.UnpublishedRedirectUrlDescription
data.value: Select a relative URL of a page or enter an absolute URL.

data.name: settingskey.ReCAPTCHAPublicAPIKey.Description
data.value:
The site API key for the site where you want to use reCAPTCHA v2.

You can get your API keys at https://www.google.com/recaptcha/admin.

data.name: settingskey.ReCAPTCHAPrivateAPIKey.Description
data.value:
The secret API key for the site where you want to use reCAPTCHA v2.

You can get your API keys at https://www.google.com/recaptcha/admin.

data.name: settingskey.ReCAPTCHAV3PublicAPIKey.Description
data.value:
The site API key for the site where you want to use reCAPTCHA v3.

You can get your API keys at https://www.google.com/recaptcha/admin.

data.name: settingskey.ReCAPTCHAV3PrivateAPIKey.Description
data.value:
The secret API key for the site where you want to use reCAPTCHA v3.

You can get your API keys at https://www.google.com/recaptcha/admin.

data.name: settingskey.ReCAPTCHAV3Threshold.Description
data.value: reCAPTCHA v3 returns a score between 0.0 (very likely a bot) and 1.0 (very likely a good interaction). Set the score threshold required for the reCAPTCHA validation to be successful.

data.name: sf.mapping.customizedfield
data.value: This field's value is mapped via custom code. Contact your developer to change how it is mapped.

data.name: sf.mapping.synchronizationwarning
data.value: This field cannot be synchronized from SalesForce to Kentico Xperience. To enable incoming synchronization for this field, you must select a standard contact field.

data.name: sf.attributecompatibility.requiresmacroconversion
data.value: The macro's value will be converted into the type '{0}' during synchronization. If it is not in the correct format, the value will not be synchronized.

data.name: automationdesigner.activationscheduler.validationerror
data.value: The Enabled from date must be before the Enabled to date.

data.name: automationdesigner.activationscheduler.infomessage
data.value: Setting the Enabled from and Enabled to value always overrides the current activation status of the process. If you leave Enable from empty, the automation process starts immediately. If you leave Enable to empty, the process will always be enabled from the specified date.

data.name: settings.validationdoubleerror
data.value: Enter a valid decimal number (according to your preferred UI culture).
